page.title: 16LEAGRAVE STATION
page.content: Leagrave Railway Station built in 1870 has roughly 7 000 people travelling a week.The busiest day is Monday,the quietest is Sunday.The earliest train is 5.48a.m.The district traffic manager does like his job.He works shifts from 6.30a.m. to 1.30p.m.The station is termed as a local station.There are no peak periods because people work flexy hours,in London offices,though in the mornings it is busy to about 10.00a.m. and in the evenings 7.30p.m.It takes 35mins,from Leagrave to London and costs Â£4.20 per day.The traffic manager's most difficult task is to deal with accidents on the line.Most people I asked found that electric trains are much better than diesel because it offers a quicker service.Lots of people take their cars to the station.
